intro: Stillingia elliptica, commonly known as the American stellaria, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are small and white or pink in color. Stillingia elliptica is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
